meanings.definition: A person or thing that rings bells.
meanings.sent1: The church hired experienced ringers to play the bells during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The ringers in the bell tower chimed beautifully on Sunday mornings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel accidentally became one of the ringers when it got stuck in the bell tower.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a chorus of ringers in a bell tower.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ringers filled the air, signaling the start of the festival.

meanings.definition: A person who is especially skilled or successful in a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: She was known as one of the best ringers in the archery competition.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was the ringer in basketball, always scoring the winning points.
meanings.sent3: The clever ringer outsmarted all the other players with a surprising move.
meanings.sent4: His quick reflexes made him a ringer on the soccer field, never missing a goal.
meanings.sent5: The talented musician was a ringer in the orchestra, playing flawlessly every time.

meanings.definition: A fraudulent contestant or competitor entered in a competition under false pretenses.
meanings.sent1: The impostor was caught pretending to be a ringer in the singing competition.
meanings.sent2: The cheating athlete was exposed as a ringer in the marathon race.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky competitor tried to pass off as a ringer, but his lack of skill gave him away.
meanings.sent4: The fake ringer's true identity was revealed when he couldn't perform as expected.
meanings.sent5: The imposter's attempt to deceive the judges as a ringer failed miserably.
